intro: Bartsia bartsioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bartsia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its lack of chlorophyll, making it a hemiparasitic plant. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments and has small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in dense clusters, and bloom during the wet season. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
